title: Celebrating 141 years
text:
NEWSPAPER SECTION: LIFE | WRITER: PICHAYA SVASTI - + On Saturday, the Fine Arts Department will celebrate the 141st anniversary of national museums by hosting academic activities called "Museum For All", from 1.30-4.30pm at Damrong Rajanuphap Auditorium, the National Museum Bangkok. 
The event includes the special lecture, "Policy to Conserve and Develop the Front Palace" by department director-general Borvornvate Rungrujee and the talk, "New Look @ National Museums", by Association of Thai Travel Agents chairman Charoen Wang-ananon, Tourism Authority of Thailand Central Region Office director Somchai Chompoonoi, academic Cheewasit Boonyakiat and National Museums Office Phanombutr Chantharachote and moderated by Khon Kaen National Museum Thossaporn Srisamarn. Visit www.facebook.com/thaimuseumday or call the National Museums Office on 02-282-8554 . Tattoo convention in Hua Hin 
On Oct 17, the "2nd Hua Hin Tattoo Convention 2015" will take place in front of Hua Hin Market Village in Hua Hin, Prachuap Khiri Khan, from 11am-10pm. 
There will be a display of tattoos created by famous Thai and foreign tattoo artists, the sale of tattooing tools, the demonstration of tattooing in line with international standards, concerts and a charity auction from which proceeds will be donated to local schools in the form of scholarships for needy students. 
The objectives of the event are to improve the image of tattoo art in Thailand, promote tourism in Hua Hin in the low season and donate the profit of the event to Thammikka Witthaya School for the Blind in Phetchaburi and the Thamma Sawang Hua Hin Foundation. Email trijaktattoo@hotmail.com or call 089-899-6967 . Promoting Udon Thani 
The Tourism Business Association of Udon Thani is promoting tourism in the province under the concept of dhamma , civilisations and nature to attract Thai and foreign visitors. 
It suggests tourists spend at least two days visiting historical and natural attractions in Udon Thani, beginning with a trip to the Nong Han Swamp or the Red Water Lily Lake in Kumphawaphi district. Covering 22,500 rai, it is full of fish and water plants, including red water lilies which blossom from dawn to 11pm from December-March. Various kinds of birds can also be seen. Ban Chiang National Museum, one of the Unesco's World Heritage sites, which shows traces of human settlement and civilisation dating to more than 5,000 years ago and includes more than 100 archaeological sites, should not be missed. 
A visit to Wat Pa Kham Chanod relating to a legend of the naga called Chao Phor Phraya Srisutthonagaraj is a must. At dusk, walking street at UD Town department store in Muang district is a delight. 
Call the Tourism Business Association of Udon Thani on 094-525-3344 . Trip to Mon communities 
On Sept 26, the Thai Khadi Research Institute, Thammasat University, will host the study trip "Visiting the Thai-Mon Communities, Ratchaburi" to Thai-Mon communities in Ban Pong and Photharam districts in Ratchaburi province from 7.30am-6pm. 
Participants will visit several temples, a local museum and experience the ways of lives of the Thai-Mon people who live on the Mae Klong River Basin. The fee is 450 baht per person and is limited to 40 persons. Deadline is Sept 22. Visit www.facebook.com/TKRI.TU or call 02-613-3203-5 ext 19 or 31 .
